intro: Eurya fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
